body.p:
Office Asst Qr Mr
Camp Nelson Ky
Decbr 14th 1863 --
Brig Genl J. T. Boyle
Louisville Ky.
General

I have the honor to report that the duties and cares of my office are so pressing that I find that I must have some assistance. It has occurred to me that if one of my old and Experienced clerks could receive a commission as 1st Lieut in the line of some regiment and then be detailed and ordered to report to me for duty, it would relieve me from a very great pressure in my official, office, duties, and enable me to give other matters suitable attention.

I have a clerk, Frederick A. Palmer,
who has been with me since August 1862, and who at that time had much Experience as a clerk in the Dept. He is a young man from Newark N. J. of high moral character and exemplary habits. He has had entire charge of my property accounts and understands thoroughly the duties of my office. I would esteem it as a great personal favor to me if you would induce Gov Bramlette to give him a Commission in some Ky, regt & allow him to remain to assist me in my office --

I am General
Very Respectfully
Your Obdt Servant
T. E. Hall
Capt & Asst Qr Mr

N. B.
It will gratify me exceedingly if the above Can be brought to pass -- Will you not exert your influence in ways that you think best, in order that it may?

H224 (D K) 1863
Office A Q M.
Camp Nelson Ky
Dec 14th 1863
Hall Captain T. E --
A. Q. M --
Recommends that Frederick A. Palmer a Clerk of his be commissioned in some Kentucky regiment and detailed to assist him.

Recd Hd Qrs D K Decr 1st 63
Head Qrs Dist of Ky
Louisville, Ky Dec 25 1863
Respectfully referred to Gov -- Thomas E. Bramlette, with recommendations, that said Palmer be commissioned as requested by Captain T. E. Hall A. Q. M.

J. T. Boyle
Brig Genl Comdg
